questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which configuration command establishes an EIGRP neighbor adjacency between the hub and spoke?

discussion.content:
How the heck you can understand what should be right there?
This question is absurd.

Selected Answer: B
based on assumption which is a trend with Cisco exam question , i will go with B

Selected Answer: B
The 'Neighbor not yet found' means that you are receiving updates, queries, or replies from an EIGRP router on this link, but the router does not recognize the sender as a valid neighbor

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/enhanced-interior-gateway-routing-protocol-eigrp/118974-technote-eigrp-00.html

Selected Answer: B
The 'Neighbor not yet found' means that you are receiving updates, queries, or replies from an EIGRP router on this link, but the router does not recognize the sender as a valid neighbor

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/enhanced-interior-gateway-routing-protocol-eigrp/118974-technote-eigrp-00.html

peer 10..1.2.1 is going down. suggesting that 10.1.2.1 its the hub so the output we see its from the spoke so answer its B. lol

how you will be able to determine if the exhebit its from the hub or the spoke?

discussion.content: Not sure, but i feel that some context of the question is missing. Please correctly if i am wrong.

choices.D: Modify route-map ospf-to-eigrp permit 30 and match prefix-list ccnp2.
choices.C: Modify prefix-list ccnp3 to add 10.1.64.0/20 le 24.
choices.B: Modify prefix-list ccnp3 to add 10.1.64.0/20 ge 32.
choices.A: Modify route-map ospf-to-eigrp permit10 and match prefix-list ccnp2.

discussion.content: I chose A as D just does not make sense it would set a tag to be 10 not 30
A is correct ...

A is correct 
look at the tag
